news.title: Goa completes 25% of land records update
news.para: Goa state government is updating land records and issuing urban property cards. Around 25 percent of this work is complete. Initial public concerns about land mergers and property confiscation have been addressed. The survey aims to accurately record land ownership. The government targets completion by February, with potential extensions if needed. This initiative ensures clear property rights for all landowners.

news.title: Every land parcel in Delhi to geta 14-digit Aadhaar number
news.para: Delhi has launched Bhu Aadhaar, assigning a 14-digit Unique Land Parcel Identification Number (ULPIN) to every land parcel to modernize records and enhance accountability. This initiative aims to combat corruption and land disputes by creating a digital 'Aadhaar' for property ownership, ensuring greater transparency and streamlining transactions.

news.title: Illegal colonies, site office razed in DTCP drive in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram's town planning enforcement wing conducted demolition drives on February 11 and 13, targeting unauthorized colonies and illegal structures in Sadhrana, Bohra Kalan, Jamalpur, and Sector 89. Foundation-level construction, boundary walls, and internal roads were razed to curb unplanned development and protect homebuyers from fraudulent deals.

news.title: Creditors back Welspun-Ashdan for Lavasa takeover with 92% vote
news.para: Creditors have chosen the Welspun-Ashdan consortium to acquire India's first private hill town, Lavasa Corp. The project faced administration due to mounting debt. The consortium secured a significant majority vote. This decision comes amid ongoing legal challenges. Valor Estate, another contender, had its plan rejected by a major creditor. The resolution professional proceeded with voting based on a court order.

news.title: Centre approves 11.56 km metro extension from Noida sector 142 to Botanical Garden
news.para: The Aqua Line Metro will extend from Botanical Garden to Noida Sector 142. This new 11.56 km stretch will add eight stations. The project is sanctioned at Rs 2,254.35 crore and aims for completion in four years. This extension will boost connectivity between Noida, Greater Noida, and Delhi. It will also improve access to IGI Airport and major railway stations.

news.title: NCLAT to hear appeal against Oberoi Realty-led consortium's ₹919crore bid for Hotel Horizon
news.para: On February 25, 2026, the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal will deliberate on an appeal disputing the endorsement of Oberoi Realty's Rs 919 crore offer for Hotel Horizon. The tribunal has mandated that no equity should be allocated to those who successfully resolved the matter. Notably, the hotel's former promoters argue that the resolution was built on misleading financial data.

news.title: Pune: MPCB gives RMC plants 20 days to follow pollution control guidelines
news.para: The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board has issued a stern warning to ready-mix concrete plant owners in Bavdhan Budruk. They must implement the latest pollution control measures within twenty days. Failure to comply will result in strict legal action. This directive follows numerous complaints from residents regarding air pollution and traffic congestion.

news.title: Sai Ishwari homebuyers in Mapusa file cheating complaint against two developers
news.para: Nine homebuyers have filed a cheating complaint against two real estate developers in Mapusa, Goa, for failing to deliver flats booked nearly a decade ago. Despite full payment for the 'Sai Ishwari' project, buyers allege false assurances and significant mental and financial distress. They also seek a probe into the cooperative credit society's loan sanction for the mortgaged project.

news.title: No more land swap, Prayagraj development body to now refund with interest to plot buyers
news.para: The Prayagraj Development Authority (PDA) will no longer offer alternate land to homebuyers who haven't taken possession of their purchased plots. Instead, affected allottees will receive a refund with interest, aiming to resolve long-pending issues and ensure transparency in residential schemes.  Homebuyers can opt to adjust their paid amount towards new allotments.

news.title: NCLT appoints two-member committee to address grievances of Jaypee Infratech allottees
news.para: The NCLT Delhi has appointed an independent committee of experts to address homebuyers' grievances regarding Jaypee Infratech projects, now under Suraksha Realty. The committee will assess construction progress against the resolution plan and report on project status and any outstanding issues. This move aims to safeguard allottees' interests and ensure timely redressal of their concerns.

news.title: Blueprint for disaster in Ahmedabad: Build homes first, excavate later for utility lines
news.para: AUDA approved numerous buildings in Shela and surrounding areas without essential underground utility networks. This oversight has caused significant waterlogging issues for residents. Now, AUDA is implementing a master plan with a loan to lay stormwater and drainage lines.

news.title: Maharashtra orders draft structure plan for Pune metropolitan region
news.para: The state government has directed the PMRDA to immediately begin preparing a draft structure plan for the Pune metropolitan region. This plan will provide a broad framework for future infrastructure development, mobility networks, and environmental protection, replacing the previously withdrawn draft development plan. The directive follows amendments to the MRTP Act, introducing the structure plan mechanism.

news.title: States draw CJI rebuke for appointing retirees to RERA
news.para: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant criticized state Real Estate Regulatory Authorities (RERAs) for failing to protect homebuyers, calling them "rehabilitation centres for retirees." In Odisha, the RERA struggles with order execution and penalty recovery, with most of the Rs 6.89 crore in imposed penalties remaining unrecovered, highlighting a need for urgent reforms and a shift towards a development-oriented model.

news.title: Maharashtra government approves PMC as planning authority for 23 merged areas
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation has been officially designated as the planning authority for 23 merged areas, ending a period of dual control. This long-awaited decision by the state government resolves confusion over building permits and development plans. PMC will now be solely responsible for preparing a new development plan and overseeing all civic upgrades in these areas.

news.title: Pune civic body imposes fine on developer for dumping debris on riverbed
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation fined a private developer Rs 10 lakh for dumping trash on a riverbed and ordered a probe into illegal waste disposal. The civic body plans to establish 10 guarded centers for scientific waste management and will file criminal offenses against those responsible for the dumping.

news.title: Signature Global, RMZ forms joint venture to develop mixed-use development in Gurugram
news.para: Signature Global and RMZ have formed a 50:50 joint venture to develop a significant mixed-use project on Gurugram's Southern Peripheral Road. RMZ will invest ₹1,283 crore in the venture, which will feature over five million sq ft of office, hotel, and retail spaces. This marks Signature Global's entry into large-scale commercial development.

news.title: Civic body kicks-off e-auction to rent out 100 commercial properties in Chandigarh
news.para: Chandigarh municipal corporation is set to rent out over 100 commercial properties through e-auctions. This includes booths in Sector 17 and Mauli Jagran, along with the Smart City office building and seven nurseries.  Base rents vary significantly, with some underpass booth prices reduced to attract bidders.

news.title: Bengaluru development body forms panel to probe Thanisandra demolition
news.para: Bangalore Development Authority has formed a committee to investigate a recent demolition drive in Thanisandra village. The inquiry will examine if proper procedures were followed during the clearing of alleged encroachments. Residents claim illegal property transactions may be involved. The committee will review documents and assess the legality of the BDA's actions. Findings will be shared after the inquiry.

news.title: Odisha officers visit Chennai to study affordable housing, urban habitat initiatives
news.para: A delegation from Odisha, led by Additional Chief Secretary Usha Padhee, visited Chennai to study affordable housing and urban habitat initiatives. The team focused on understanding successful models, financing frameworks, and sustainable development strategies supported by the World Bank and ADB in Tamil Nadu. Insights gained will inform Odisha's urban development plans.
